headline: Ballots Packed With Candidates In Senate And Governor Race
author: Tyler Friel
sentences:
Lou Barletta, former Congressman
Joe Gale, Montgomery County Commissioner
Jake Corman, state senator
Charlie Gerow, conservative activist
Melissa Hart, former Congresswoman
Doug Mastriano, state senator
Jason Richey, Pittsburgh-based attorney
Bill McSwain, former U.S. attorney
Dave White, Delaware County businessman
Nche Zama, heart surgeon
Meanwhile, Josh Shapiro was the only Democrat to be on the ballot.

candidate and real estate executive
Dave McCormick, former hedge fund manager
Mehmet Oz, doctor and television host
Carla Sands, former ambassador in Trump administration
George Bochetto, Philadelphia lawyer
Sean Gale, lawyer
The Democratic primary will feature five candidates.

Governor and former Braddock mayor
Conor Lamb, Congressman of the 17th District
Malcom Kenyatta, state representative from Philadelphia
Alex Khalil, liberal activist
Kevin Baumlin, doctor based in Philadelphia
We have a full list of candidates at ButlerRadio.com.

So here’s the breakdown:
10 Republican candidates qualified for the ballot in the race for governor.
It’s going to be a crowded ballot in both the Senate and Governor races this spring.
The deadline passed for candidates to submit their nominating petitions yesterday.

Kathy Barnette, conservative commentator and activist
Jeff Bartos, former Lt. Gov.
In the Republican race for Senate, there are seven total candidates.
